alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 2:07AM EST until February 18 at 9:20PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 25.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 15.7 feet and begin rising again early Sunday morning. It will rise to 18.3 feet Monday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.6 feet on 02/05/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
